messages.messageBody:
Crystal,
Thanks so much! :-) I would have never thought of nursing homes.


Barb E
"Listen to your life. See it for the fathomless mystery that it
is. In the boredom and pain of it no less than in the
excitement and gladness: touch, taste, smell your way to
the holy and hidden heart of it because in the last
analysis all moments are key moments, and life itself is
grace."

- Frederick Buechner, Author, in "Now and Then"




on 8/9/03 2:21 PM, Crystal at crystal.pina@... wrote:

>
> .>Any ideas for good but cheap
>> boxes?
>
> Yes. Ask at any nursing home for the supply clerk. They have large boxes
> that diapers came in that is good for blankets and clothes. They have
> smaller, sturdier boxes that latex gloves came in for packing your heavier
> items. If anyone in your household is allergic to latex, ask for only the
> boxes vynal gloves come in because the latex dust gets on everything. Ask
> them what day their shipment comes in because they probably will need the
> boxes picked up right away. There is never enough room to store them.
>
> Crystal

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] Re: boxes
messages.msgSnippet: ... Wow, thank you. . Any ideas for good but cheap ... Yes.  Ask at any nursing home for the supply clerk.  They have large boxes that diapers came in that is
messages.messageBody:
> Crystal,
> I like the way you think

Wow, thank you.

.>Any ideas for good but cheap
> boxes?

Yes. Ask at any nursing home for the supply clerk. They have large boxes
that diapers came in that is good for blankets and clothes. They have
smaller, sturdier boxes that latex gloves came in for packing your heavier
items. If anyone in your household is allergic to latex, ask for only the
boxes vynal gloves come in because the latex dust gets on everything. Ask
them what day their shipment comes in because they probably will need the
boxes picked up right away. There is never enough room to store them.

Crystal
